text: guys today's dish is both kind of insane
and kind of fabulous it's a crispy
potato roast and what you need to do is
get four pounds of potatoes peel them
and then slice them as thinly as you
possibly have and of course I prefer to
do mine on a mandolin because I can get
them extra extra extra thin this way you
have a really sharp knife you can do it
with a knife but I'm getting them so
they're almost paper thin which is
almost impossible really to do with a
knife especially with potatoes because
they're so starchy so slice four pounds
of potatoes get your oven preheated to
375 this is most of the work of this
recipe though which is kind of great it
sits in the oven for about two hours
total but you can certainly be doing
many many many other things while you're
waiting so don't worry about the time
don't look at the time and be like I'm
not making that it is really almost no
work at all after you slice your
potatoes of course this is going to need
some fat in which to cook and crisp so I
am going to do a combination of three
tablespoons of melted butter and three
tablespoons of olive oil okay so what
you want to do is brush the bottom of a
9-inch dish this is a baking dish it's
nine inches at the bottom it's a little
bit bigger at the top but I feel like
that's okay and then layer your potatoes
into the dish now what you do is you
shingle your potatoes in sort of
standing straight up at the beginning
it's going to be a little bit difficult
to do that because there's not going to
be anything for them to lean against but
eventually they'll go all the way around
and then you can stand them up a little
bit
the thinner that your potatoes are the
crisper that they'll get as they're
baking so try to get them as thin as you
can it's a humongous pile of potatoes
four pounds of potatoes is a lot and
that's what this makes a great side dish
for a party now I'm putting these in the
center you can fit four pounds of
potatoes in a nine inch baking dish so
just keep artfully arranging them you
can do something more artful than what I
did and
Center if you want like make it into a
rose or something maybe it should have
done that but I didn't it's too late you
can do it though and then take a picture
of it and tag me Sara carry one on
Instagram now I'm going to go back in
and sprinkle some salt between layers my
hands are kind of wet so sticky
potatoes I love salt I think and
sprinkle the whole top with salt in a
little bit of hot pepper flakes and then
add some shallots for shallots thickly
sliced lengthwise and then sort of stick
the shallots in random spots into the
potatoes the potatoes I kind of feel
like it looks cool already right I think
so now you can brush the remaining oil
and butter mixture over the top of the
entire thing making sure to get every
single piece of potato and shallot as
you go oh yes the butter is drizzling
down between the layers of potato and
coating all the potatoes really nicely
then you just get this into your 375
degree oven you bake it for an hour and
15 minutes and then you take some time
and you add your time to it you don't
want to add it too early or it'll
overcook and then you cook it for about
another 35 minutes till the potatoes are
golden and cooked through
there you go it's done it's golden brown
and crispy on the top and like soft and
luscious on the inside perfect for your
next dinner party enjoy
you
